choices: You're about to crash land on Planet Zork
You're navigating the ocean when a storm approaches
You're flying above the jungle when the engine sputters
You're flying above the desert when the engine sputters
You're paddling in a canoe when a storm approaches
1.content:
You're traveling somewhere before you're about to become stranded.

Please pick from the following scenes:
1.title: Set the scene

choices: Ron meets Org, and Org takes him home
Ron meets Org, but Org leaves him by the lake
Ron meets Org, but Org leaves and comes back with Ank, his father
11.content:
Ron looked out the cockpit window and saw the surface of the strange, blue planet rising fast. His small spaceship was being pulled in by the powerful gravity of the planet, which was circling around the bright twin suns along with the double moons. The sight from the cockpit was spectacular; however, Ron didn’t have time to enjoy the view. He was becoming increasingly concerned about the inevitable: Crashing on the strange, unknown planet!

“Voyager 39 to Earth! Voyager 39 to Earth! Losing altitude fast! Traveling at 1100 miles per hour, descending on a small, unknown planet… It appears to have an atmosphere… All readings indicate that the planet will sustain human life form… Presence of water and oxygen have been detected…”

The ship broke through the outer atmosphere and plunged towards the surface in a raging fireball. Ron saw that, in order to survive, he had to eject quickly, and hope he could land somewhere in a safe spot.

“”Voyager 39! I’m going to eject from the craft! Send rescue! Here are final coordinates! Mayday Mayday! Astronaut Ron McGee, Space Administration, ID number 465863. Final coordinates follow this message. Send for rescue! Mayday, Mayday. Altitude 7,000 feet… 6,000 feet… 5,000 feet… Passing over the ocean… Coming over what looks like farmland… swampland, maybe… 3,000 feet… Location coordinates follow… Will eject from craft… Over and out!” was Ron’s last message.

The spacecraft raced towards the ground, when the canopy popped off and the seat ejected, showing the pilot sitting on it. As the spacecraft came down, it splashed into a small lake, which was surrounded by grass and bushes. In the meantime, Ron pulled a pin, which was just under his seat, and a parachute was released from the back of his suit. He unstrapped himself from the chair, and allowed his body to float to the ground, while the chair crashed into the lake below.

After a few moments, Ron landed in a bush. He managed to get himself untangled, but cutting his parachute loose. Then, he tumbled to the ground and lay on the grass, as he turned and saw his space ship, floating to the surface of the lake before him. He considered himself to be very, very lucky.

Ron finally got up and looked around. It was hot and humid. The air was thick and there was a slight breeze. Clearly, there was plenty of water on the planet. There was vegetation. He could live there for awhile. Yes, he could survive. The question is: Where would he live? What would the people on the planet be like?

As soon as he started walking, his ankle hurt like crazy, and it caused him to fall down in the grass.

“Ahhh!” he cried. He hurt his ankle in the fall, and he needed to let it rest. He looked down at his leg. No, he didn’t think he had sprained it, but it did hurt. He just lay on the grass for a few minutes. He was completely exhausted. What was he going to do now?

Then, suddenly, he looked up. There was a noise in the distance. He heard something, or someone approaching.

“Oh, no…” he grumbled.

He was in no condition to run away right now. What if there was some creature, or some dangerous animal lurking behind a tree? He would be doomed!

Something moved in the distance! Ron got on his knees and crawled behind a bush to see what it was. He looked up and began to realize that something large was coming his way. This was not good!

What was he going to do?
11.title: You're about to crash land on Planet Zork

choices: Ron meets Ank, Org's father
Ron meets Org's friends
111.content:
Ron lurked from behind the thick bushes as he lay on his stomach, trying to do his best not to be seen by the strange, large creature. So far, the creature was walking among the trees, just from the distance. It appeared to be moving towards the lake. This was not good, since that was where the space ship was!

Then, suddenly, the creature took off! It leaped into the sky like a bird! That was strange, for it didn’t appear to have wings! How was that possible?

Ron looked up and saw the creature flying over towards the lake. He caught a glimpse of it. Was it a human being? It seemed to have arms and legs. It appeared to be a male figure. Ron had lost sight of it, and didn’t see it for a moment. He had panicked for a moment. Where did it go?

Suddenly, Ron heard a “THUD” sound behind him, followed by the voice of a young boy.

“Oooh, there you are!” the boy said, in his own language.

Ron turned around and gasped out loud.

“Whaaaaahh!” he shouted.

Standing before him was a boy, who appeared to be about nine feet tall. He had golden, tan skin, and black hair with bright, blue eyes and a friendly face. He wore no shirt and no shoes and no socks, but just a pair of shorts which covered his waist and part of his upper legs. Aside from the boy’s remarkable height, the thing most striking about him, were his muscles!

The giant boy had large, firm pectorals which jutted out from his chest like armor. Thick, round biceps graced his upper arms and three rows of mighty abdominals covered his large torso, just beneath those large pectorals. Truly, the boy looked like a warrior!

Supporting his giant body were two thick, long legs, made up of thick layers of muscles on his thighs and large round calves which were almost as big as soccer balls. Ron took note that this boy wasn’t to be messed around with!

Ron’s mouth dropped wide open, as he craned his neck, in order to examine the towering boy, who loomed over him.

“Come on, poor little guy… You must be hungry!” the boy said, as he motioned with his hands for Ron to follow him.

“So… Who are you?” Ron asked, as he slowly got back on his feet. He was absolutely amazed by the giant muscle boy.

“Come! There is my house!” the boy said, as he pointed to a large structure, which was about half a mile away, on the other side of the lake.

“Oooh…” Ron realized that this is where the boy wanted to take him.

“I’m Org…” the boy said, as he pointed at his chest.

“Org?” Ron replied.

“Org!” the giant boy smiled, as he repeated his name as he pointed his finger at his chest for the second time.

“I’m Ron… I came from Earth!” Ron said as he pointed at his chest.

“Aaaahhh… Earth!” Org smiled, as he pointed at Ron.

“No, no, no!” Ron shook his head. “Earth is up there!” he said as he pointed to the sky.

But it was no use. Org didn’t understand. He thought his name was earth, and Ron didn’t want to confuse the boy even more.

“Come on, Earth, you poor little guy! You must be hungry and tired!” Org said, as he started to walk towards the house.

Unfortunately, Ron’s ankle was still bothering him, and he couldn’t walk very fast. On the other hand, Org hand long, strong legs, so he was walking much faster than Ron. When Org realized that Ron was having a hard time keeping pace with him, he stopped, turned around, and walked back to where Ron was walking.

“Poor little baby… Let me carry you!” Org said, as he reached down and easily picked up Ron with his mighty, muscular arms.

“Hey! I can walk on my own, you big lug!” Ron protested.

“Let me fly you home! That is much faster!” Org said, as he looked down at Ron’s face with a grin.

Ron was about to protest again, when he suddenly felt like he was floating in the air.

“Hey! What… What the heck?”

When he turned his head, he saw that Org was no longer walking… He was flying!

“Holy cow! You can fly!” Ron said to the giant boy.

The giant boy gently hovered over to his house, and touched down on the grass, right in front of the door to the house. Ron was absolutely amazed by Org’s size, muscularity, and now his flying ability. This kid was amazing!

Org set Ron on the floor and then he opened the door, allowing Ron to walk in first. As soon as they were inside, he closed the door behind him. Now, all Org had to do, was show Ron around, and wait till his father, Ank, got home. He couldn’t wait to show his father his new little friend named Earth!
111.title: Ron meets Org, and Org takes him home

choices: "How cute, who is he?" with delight
"Who's the little runt?" with disdain
Other
1112.content:
Ron was more and more amazed at the giant boy's strength... in fact, Org had just opened and closed with one arm a massive metal door, that surely wighed several tons! The astronaut stared nervously at the door, and tentatively seized the doorknob and tried to push it down... with no results, it was very hard.

"Oh great!" the man thought "i'm stuck here with a kid who could crush me like nothing... well, at least he seems gentle...."

"What are you doing, Eath?" Org's childish yet powerful voice interrupted Ron's thoughts, although he could not understand what his host was saying. "You mustn't go out, I have to show you my house. You're going to like it!" The boy smiled widely, taking Ron's hand and pulling him toward the kitchen, while the small man didn't dare to protest, not wanting to displease the powerful kid.

The kitchen alone was larger than Ron't house on Earth, he mused, watching the massive wooden furniture, that made him feel the size of a toddler, and the humongous stove, carved in gray stone. "What kind of mighty giant could've carved this stove and carried it here?" Ron wondered.

"Look, Earth" Org was saying, pointing to the stove. "We aleays bake our bread here... you should taste it... Oh, by the way" His face became concerned, "Are you hungry, poor little guy?"

Had Ron understood the question, he would've replied affirmatively, but not knowing Org's language, he just stared at the giant blankly... but just then, they both heard childish voices approaching with loud stomps.

Org's face immediately lit up. "Wow, my friends! They came at the right moment!" He looked at ROn with a wide smile. "They'll like you, little Earth!"

"Org!" "Org!" "You home?" the voices called from outside, and Org quickly shouted "Yeah, come in, I have something to show you!"

A moment later, the door was pushed open and four boys ran in, scaring Ron, because they were huge, though none of them reached Org's size.

Irmri, a slender redhead, Gurt, a stocky blackhaired boy, Neem, a chubby kid with spiked brown hair and freckles, and Lim, a cute blondie, the youngest of the bunch at age 9, and the smallest at the height of 6' 10'', were Org's best friends, and they all admired him for his strength and kindness, looking at him as a role model.

Now they were about to greet Org merrily, when they noticed Ron and they stopped, puzzled, looking at the Earthling curiosly.

Neem was the first one who spoke:
1112.title: Friends

choices: The four boys leave Org and Ron alone.
The four boys are more gentle with Ron this time.
11121.content:
Before Ron could run away, he was quickly surrounded by the four boys, while Org was busy making sandwiches in the kitchen.

Ron suddenly became very afraid, when he was surrounded by these four giant boys, who were all bigger, taller and stronger than him! What could he do?

“Awww… He looks so cute!” Neem said, as he stepped closer and extended his arms. Before Ron could run away, Neem had lifted Ron below his armpits and was holding him a few inches above the ground.

Ron was absolutely terrified. In fact, he was in so much shock; he didn’t dare say anything at first.

“Hey! I want to hold him, too!” Lim said out loud. Neem gently passed Ron to Lim, who grabbed hold of Ron by his arms like he was holding a doll.

Luckily, Org noticed how the four boys were standing together and had surrounded Ron in the living room.

“Hey! Be careful with him!” Org said to the four boys. “He just came here and his foot got hurt!”

“Give him to me!” Gurt said, as he impatiently walked up to Lim. “I want to hold him!”

“Alright, alright!” Lim sighed, handing Ron to his bigger brother.

Gurt grabbed Ron by his wrists and then he quickly started spinning him around in a circle.

“Hey! HEY!” Org shouted. “You’re making him dizzy! Stop it!! STOP!”

Gurt slowed down and set Ron on the floor. Immediately Ron fell down, since he had become dizzy from being spun around in a circle.

Then Gurt walked up to Ron and picked him up, when Irmri got to him and tried pulling him away.

“Hey! You had your turn! Now it’s my turn!” Irmri shouted.

“It’s still my turn!” Gurt said.

“MY turn!” Irmri shouted back.

Both boys started pulling on Ron’s arms.

“Auuuwwww!!!” Ron shouted.

“STOP!” Org screamed, as he ran into the living room. “LEAVE HIM ALONE!”

This startled the boys immensely, and they immediately backed off. Ron quickly ran up to Org and embraced the huge, muscular boy. Org was clearly his protector.

What would happen next?
11121.title: "How cute, who is he?" with delight

choices: Ron tries to explain by drawing a picture detailing his arrival on Zork.
Ank arrives.
111211.content:
Org gently hushed Ron as he hugged the tiny visitor, his vast fingers rubbing his back. The four boys continued backing away, clearly ashamed of their action.

"M... Maybe we should just leave him to get... used to being here," Gurt finally spoke, "You want to... want to go and practice Tak-Nak?" he awkwardly asked the others. Irmri, Lim and Neem silently nodded before they made their way out of the door. As Gurt turned to go, he finally looked over his shoulder at Ron and Org. "We are sorry, Org. We didn't mean to hurt him. He can... he can visit us whenever you want. It won't happen again." With that, he left, closing the door.

At last, Ron relaxed in Org's embrace. There was no doubt about it; if he was to survive on this planet, he would have to remain with Org for a long time, or at least long enough to salvage his ship.

"Are you feeling better, Earth?" Org finally asked, a nervous edge to his voice, "I am sorry they were so rough with you. They are really nice, normally."

For all that he could not understand the words, Ron had an inkling of what Org was saying. Giving the giant boy one last squeeze about the waist, he backed away and smiled up at him long enough for Org to smile back and relax. He stood still, allowing Org to gently pet him.

"I don't know if we have ever seen someone like you before, Earth," he said, as he gently ran a finger through Ron's hair, "We have small people among us. We often had. But none were like you. Are you one of us, or did you come to us from beyond? I heard a great crash near where I found you..." As he scratched Ron's hair, Org let his head lean to one side, his brows gently furrowed in thought.

Ron looked up, allowing his protector to continue petting him. He watched as Org continued talking to himself in his alien language; the sooner he learned it, the better. All the while, Org continued staring at him.

Was he asking about his origins? How he came to be on this world? If so, how was he going to answer these questions?
111211.title: Peace and Quiet at Last

choices: They eat their snacks and feed Ron.
Org's Father comes.
111212.content:
Org made a compassionate face while hugging the smaller guy protectively and patted his back, trying to comfort him.
"Come on, come on, little Earth." he said in a sweet voice, "It's over, nobody's going to hurt you as long as I'm with you..." He then glared to his friends. "Look at what you've done! You scared this poor little guy to death!"

"Sorry...." the four boys meekly replied, lowering their gazes... the last thing they wanted was to make Org angry at them!

Luckily, Org just sighed and warned them in a calm yet firm voice: "You act this way again, you have to deal with my wrath, got it?"

They gulped and nodded.

"Fine." Org picked up Ron, cradling him on one arm, and walked to the kitchen. "Let's eat some sandwiches, then wait for Dad.... and then we could go out."

His friends followed him and they all sat at the massive table, that was taller than Ron... but the man wasn't standing, nor was he sitting by himself, since Org had placed him on his lap, much to his embarrassment.
"Hey, wait, let me down!" Ron protested, squirming.
"What are you doing, Earth?" Org held his little guest firmly. "Be good, if you fall down, you'll get hurt!"
Gurt chuckled, gently patting Ron's head while he sat beside Org. "Eh eh, the little one's feisty! Where does he come from?"

Org explained how he had found Earth earlier, and his friends concluded that they hoped Earth could stay here.
"So that we'll get a new plaything!" Neem laughed.
Org, annoyed, protested: "He's not a plaything, he's just a poor little lost boy who needs protection!"
111212.title: Earth, the runt of the group

choices: The boys go outside and practice Tak-Nak
The boys go for a swim in the lake
1112121.content:
"What a cute little guy!" Neem said, as he tried to grab a piece of bread and shove it down Ron's throat. "Eat up, little guy!"

"NO! You're giving him too much!" Org shouted angrily, as he snatched the slice of bread out of Neem's hand. He grabbed it right on time, since Ron started to choke on the large block of bread, which was being forced down his throat. "Let me do it!"

Org grabbed the piece of bread and he broke it into three smaller pieces. Then he lifted Ron off his chair, and placed him on his own lap.

"There, Earth! Are you feeling better now?" Org said, in a friendly tone of voice. "I will take care of you! Here, thy this small piece first!"

Org handed Ron a small piece of bread, so that Ron could place it in his mouth himself. Ron chewed on it for a moment, before swallowing. The bread tasted nice and sweet, almost like pound cake.

"Wasn't that good?" Org asked him, looking down at the little man, who was sitting on his lap like a little child.

"Darn... He only listens to you!" Neem said angrily.

"You better believe it!" Org responded firmly. "He's mine and I will take care of him!"

Org gave Ron the second slice and watched Ron eat it, while Org poured a glass of water. Then he gave Ron some water to drink.

"I told you he was hungry! See?" Org said.

"Well hurry up so we can go outside and play with him!" Neem said, losing patience.

"Give him a few minutes to digest his food! I don't want him to get sick! Look, his tummy is getting full!" Org chuckled, while running his big hand over Ron's stomach.

Ron looked up at Org with a loving gaze. Now he was absolutely certain that Org was his master and his protector. He wasn't going to leave him out of his sight...
1112121.title: They eat their snacks and feed Ron.

choices: Ron sleeps with Org that night
Org lets Ron take a shower with him
11121211.content:
“Can we go and practice some Tak-Nak now?” Gurt asked his friend.

“So I can beat you guys… again?” Org grinned, as he lovingly held Ron on his lap. Ron became curious to what they were talking about.

“We haven’t trained all week!” Irmri shouted.

“Fine! This will show Earth what Tak-Nak is and how we fight!” Org said, as he gently set Ron against the palm tree. “You stay here and watch, okay?”

Org then removed his robe, revealing his big, muscular torso and his long legs and muscular arms.

Irmri, Gurt, Neem and Lim then also removed their robes, which revealed their muscular bodies since they were now only wearing their shorts.

“Who wants to go first?” Org said calmly.

Gurt, the stocky boy with black hair, came forward. Org then raised his fists and let out a loud battle cry!

“YAAAAA!!!”

Ron looked up in shock! The boys engaged in a type of fighting which closely resembled Martial Arts on Earth, a combination of kickboxing and karate.

Org just went ballistic as he charged at Gurt, swinging his right foot at him, hitting his chest with one blow after another. When Gurt tried to strike back, Org was as fast as a cheetah, leaping out of the way and evading his blows. Finally, Org charged at him and belted him with two mighty blows, which brought him down.

“Next!”

Little Lim came out, knowing he didn’t stand a chance against the big, powerful Org. Org knew that, so he went easy on him. In fact, Org was actually coaching him a bit as he moved closer to the boy.

“Move closer, hold your fists up… UP… UP… Alright, strike with your leg… Come on… be quick… Do it before I hit you… Very good…” Org was saying to the younger boy, who threw a few kicks and punches at Org. But Org didn’t feel a thing and just laughed.

“Okay, enough of that! NEXT!”

Irmri got up next, who started to swing and throw punches right away. At first, Org allowed him to strike at him, letting his friend give it his all. Then Org went into beastmode and he pounded him, swinging his leg and pounding him with one blow after another, until the bow dropped to the ground!

“NEXT!”

Finally, it was Neem’s turn. Neem was the big chubby kid with the spiky brown hair. Neem was a big bow so Org knew that it would be harder to take him down and Neem’s punches would be harder as well. Neem came out kicking and punching right away, but Org had the height and the muscle to absorb the blows. Finally, after about a minute, Org retaliated and started firing back, returning Neem’s blows with his own and punching back.

The two big boys were exchanging blows back and forth and it was a match of endurance. But Org, who was in much better physical condition than the chubby, overweight Neem, held out longer as Neem began to get tired. When Neem started to slow down and lose energy, Org cranked up the power and pounded him with kicks and punches until Neem dropped to his knees.

“Stop! Org! STOP!” he cried out when Org ceased his attack.

“Alright! Practice is over! Everybody huddle together!” Org ordered as the boys came up to him. They all embraced each other in a huddle and Org led them in a short prayer thanking the Gods for their health and their strength before they broke up and walked over to the palm tree where Ron was sitting, watching the entire competition in complete amazement.

Ron was completely amazed and totally impressed with Org. Now he loved the giant muscle boy even MORE! He was a fighter and a superhero to him!

Org sat down and gently lifted Ron on his lap, placing Ron’s legs over his long, muscular legs.

“There! You’re sleeping with me tonight, after I take a shower!” Org whispered to him as he gently pressed Ron against his bulging, muscular chest.

Ron couldn’t be happier as the other four boys looked on with envy.
11121211.title: The boys go outside and practice Tak-Nak

choices: A group of kids, 12 years old, 15 feet tall
A group of kids. 15 years old, 18 feet tall
A group of kids, 10 years old, 20 feet tall
One child, 15 feet tall
One child, 20 feet tall
12.content:
Robb Myers was transporting his cargo through the Indian Ocean. In the holds below, he was transporting various foods to deliver to his biggest client, Acme Foods, Inc.back in America. He had fruits and vegetables native to the region, as well as many different forms of protein supplement bars he had promised to deliver to another client in the area, a former rugby athlete and now the owner of a chain of bodybuilding gyms.

Robb noticed the sun was beginning to set, so he put his ship on autopilot, then retired to his sleeping quarters below.

A few hours later, he was awakened, as his ship was whipping back and forth against the waves violently. He was thrown from his bed and groaned as he got to his feet.

Robb made his way upward,in an effort to navigate through this rough patch of sea. He glanced over at the radar resting near the steering equipment, when he saw he was in the middle of two competing hurricanes.

He picked up the radio. "Hello! Cargo ship in need of assistance! I'm in the middle of the Indian Ocean and need rescue! Is there anyone out there?!"

He listened on the other end. Robb could hear someone's voice, but it was breaking up. He could only make out certain words. "Please...position...rescue...assistance...location...wait patiently," the man said, in a heavy Indian accent.

Robb looked out into the ocean, the ship rocking back and forth, almost knocking him off balance on a number of occasions. In the darkness, beyond the whipping wind and rain, he could make out a wave. Looking to be nearly 50 feet tall, it was coming straight for his ship.

With no time to react, Robb braced himself for impact. Within a matter of seconds, the wave crashed into the ship, flooding the navigation area where he was at. The last thing he remembered before he blacked out was the sound of the radio shorting out, his ship beginning to sink...,

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Robb awakened a few hours later, a gentle breeze blowing through his hair. He was lying face down on the sand. He groaned, glancing up at his surroundings. He appeared to be on an island of some sort.

Robb heard the voice of children's laughter coming from behind him.

He sat up, eyes going wide, as he saw...
12.title: You're navigating the ocean when a storm ap...

choices: At the boys' village
At Adam's house
Somewhere else
121.content:
Robb sat up, looking ahead, at three kids, each appearing to be giant, going through the food in his ship.

"Hey, give me some of that!" one kid said, grabbing a handful of fruit from one of the crates, stuffing it all in his mouth.

"I saw it first!" the other kid said, picking up the crate and placing it closer to his body. Another one stood near a hole in the ship, taking another crate out. Putting it down, he ripped it open, revealing a supply of the protein bars. "Hey, guys, look at this!" The other kids gathered around, grabbing as many of the bars as they could.

"Hey!" Robb yelled out, deciding immediately that it probably wasn't the best idea he's ever had. "Stay away from that food!"

All three kids turned, looking at the man. "Hey, he's alive!" one of them said, walking over to him. "We thought you had died. We even poked you with a stick a couple times, just to make sure." The boy approached Robb, and noticed that he barely came up to his knee. "What are you going to do about it, shorty?" One of his massive fingers came down, poking him hard in the chest, knocking him over. He then put his foot over his body.

"Stop it, Dwayne!" another boy said, running up to the first kid.. "Don't hurt him!"

Dwayne removed his foot. "Relax, I wasn't going to hurt him. Just having some fun." He walked off, going back to the wrecked ship, to get more food.

"Are you okay?" the other child asked, bending down. He smiled sympathetically.

"Y-yeah," Robb said, standing up. He looked up at the boy. He had to be around 15 feet tall. His frame was massive. The boy's chest was massive, resembling twin barrels, with deep separations. It had to measure close to 75 or 80", based on his size. His arms were 43" around; his shoulders more closely resembled football goal posts, although that was an exaggeration. His leg muscles held tremendous power, looking more like sequoias, with all four heads of the quadriceps clearly separated. His back muscles flared outward, from his massive and thick traps at the top,to the lats at the bottom, giving him an incredibly powerful appearance.

In fact, upon looking over at the other boys, they also had the same body type and physique, too. Just where was he?

"My name's Adam," the boy said, his typical children's voice seemingly out of place for a body that large.

"Robb," the man replied, looking up cautiously at the child.

"Pay no attention to Dwayne," he said, sitting down on the ground in front of Robb, causing the ground to shake on impact. "He's aways a jerk to everyone." The boy glanced over at Robb's ship. "Just where did you get all that food?"

"I was shipping it to some very important people when I ran into a few hurricanes. I doubt they'd want their stuff now."

"Sorry about that," Adam said. We were just so hungry."

"That's okay," Robb said, looking over at the boy's friends. They were lying on the ground, their stomachs full. "I guess you guys have enough food for a while, huh?"

"A week, at best," Adam replied. "Besides, there are other kids on the island. They'll want some of it, too."

A few minutes later, the other two boys approached. "Ready to go?"

"Yeah," Adam said, standing up. "You're coming with me, little guy." He bent down and picked Robb up.

"Hey, hey!" he protested. "I can walk!"

"Trust me, it's faster this way." Adam replied.

All three boys then started running, picking up incredible speed as they went along. Suddenly, all three leapt into the air, arching high into the air, before landing a few miles away, deep on the island. The ground shook violently as they landed, Robb feeling the most from their impact.

Where were they?
121.title: A group of kids, 12 years old, 15 feet tall

choices: "Sure."
"Not really."
"I don't know, yet."
1211.content:
When all three boys landed, Robb looked around. There were a half-dozen huts, log cabin-type homes and other establishments to live in. It was a small village, but it, apparently, was thriving.

Dwayne and the other kid, Stephen, started spreading the news about the ship that crashed on the island and about all the food inside. Pretty soon, most of the other giant boys ran off, to bring the food back to the village.

Adam was still carrying Robb, cradled in his arms like a puppy or a baby.

"You know, you can put me down now," the man told the boy.

Adam shrugged his shoulders. "Suit yourself." He placed the small man on the ground and continued walking towards his home, forcing Robb to run to keep up with the boy's longer strides.

They approached his log cabin and walked inside. Adam looked down at Robb, who was wheezing and gasping for breath. "I told you," the child said, walking over to a chair and sitting down. Robb took a few deep breaths and sat down on the floor, in front of the child.

"Are you thirsty or hungry?" Adam asked.

"Thirsty...yes," the man said, in between breaths. "Hungry...not so much." Adam walked into the kitchen and poured some water into a glass, returning a few moments later, placing the glass in front of Robb. The glass was nearly half as tall as the man himself and he was struggling to drink from it. Adam went back to the kitchen and got a straw.

After taking a few sips, Robb relaxed.

There was a knock at the door. Adam opened it to find the remaining boys in the village wanting to see the tiny man he discovered. Adam looked over at Robb. The man slowly nodded his head. Adam let them in and soon, Robb was picked off the ground, being inspected, poked, prodded and otherwise manhandled for the next thirty minutes or so.

"You're coming to the party tonight, right?" one kid asked Adam.

"What party?" Adam responded, holding Robb in his lap, as he sat in his chair.

"A party celebrating all of the food you guys found today. I mean, there as to be at least 50 or 60 crates tucked inside that ship."

"Oh," Adam said. "I guess I'll be there, then."

"Are you going to bring your new pet?" another kid asked.

"If he wants to come," Adam responded.

"Well, we have to head back home," the first kid said, as all the kids stood up. "We have chores to do, food to catch, stuff like that."

The other kids left, leaving Adam and Robb alone.

"So, do you want to go to the party?" Adam asked Robb.
1211.title: At the boys' village

choices: Yes
No
12111.content:
"Sure, why not?" Robb responded.

"Okay, cool."

A few moments later, the entire house shook violently.

"What the hell was that?" Robb asked, looking up at Adam.

"Probably just a few of the guys returning with crates from your ship." He stood up and looked outside. "Yep." A few seconds later, a few more returned, shaking the house to its' core.

"Um, this is probably going to continue for a few hours or so," Adam cautioned. "I'm going to go lie down for a while." He stood up, placing Robb in his chair. "You tired, too?"

"Well, no," Robb replied. "But, if you want the company, I could stay with you."

"All right." Adam then picked the man up again and carried him to his room, where he placed him in a recliner. "There. You should be safe here."

The child laid down in his bed, as Robb tried to get comfortable in the oversized chair. Just then, another boy slammed down from the sky, shaking the earth again.

"How do you sleep like this? With all of the noise outside?" Robb asked.

"You get used to it," he replied.

Over the next few hours, while Adam slept, Robb tried to ignore the pounding outside, as the boys returned, then took off again. Eventually, after shifting in his seat and being able to block some of the noise out, he drifted off to sleep.

*****************************

It was nighttime. Robb was still sleeping in the recliner, when Adam came in and woke him up. "Hey, the party's already started." He jabbed the man lightly in the stomach, driving all the air from his lungs, but also succeeding in waking him up, too.

Robb opened his eyes, stretching. He looked up at the massive child.

"I thought I'd let you sleep a little bit longer," Adam said, picking him up and walking towards the front door. "Now come on. You're the reason we have the party."

The two walked outside and the cool night air hit Robb in the face, waking him up a little bit. As they approached the other boys, the man could see most of them sitting around a bonfire, dancing, playing instruments, some even singing. As Adam approached them, they all stopped and looked up at him.

"I present to you," Adam said, holding Robb above his head with both hands. "The man who made this celebration possible: Adam!" He then passed the tiny man to the person on his left, ignoring Robb's cries of protest. After that person was done with him, that person then passed Robb to another boy. And so on. It was like show and tell.

Does something happen to Robb while he's being passed around?
12111.title: "Sure."

choices: The next day
A week to 10 days later
121111.content:
Dwayne was waiting for Robb to be passed to him. He was jealous, not only of the attention being paid to the tiny man, but also the fact that Adam was taking care of him. The goody-two shoes. Always trying to do the right thing.

He watched as Robb got closer, a nervous look on the man's face as he was passed from person to person.. "Just one more person away," he said to himself.

Finally, the tiny man was passed to him. He looked down into Robb's face, that same nervous look plastered on his face. Dwayne looked around, trying to find a good escape route.

Suddenly, the boy stood up and began running towards the woods, with a few people chasing after him. Adam was one of those people and he watched as Dwayne leaped into the air, disappearing into the darkness of the night.

Robb was held tightly in Dwayne's hand, to keep him from falling out.

Adam leaped after him, hoping to see his former friend jump again, or at least to hear his body slam down on the ground. But there wasn't any trace of him. Adam searched for most of the night, covering most of the island, but his search came up empty. Dejected, he returned back to his village, not speaking to anyone, but rather, going into his room and crying.

On the other end of the island, Dwayne crept silently through the night. After that first initial jump, he decided to lay low,to keep Adam off of his trail. The terrified man in his hand tried escaping, but Dwayne just increased the pressure around his body, causing Robb to stop moving around.

He eventually came upon his other home on the island, a hut near the coast, close to where Robb's ship crashed. He walked inside, plopping down in one of the chairs, making himself comfortable.

"Okay, here are the rules," Dwayne began. "If you do what I tell you, then I'll feed you and try to keep you in a warm, dry place at night. Disobey,or fail to complete my tasks, and...well, I guess you'll be going without food for that day."

"Now," Dwayne said, setting him down inside one of his dresser drawers. "Sleep tight. You work begins tomorrow morning. Try to escape and I'll kill you." Dwayne laughed, as he closed the drawer, leaving Robb in darkness.

How long is it until Robb's found?
121111.title: Yes

choices: Robb sound asleep
Gone!  Someone took Robb (or he escaped)
121112.content:
Robb is passed around, until every boy has a chance to see him. He's given back to Adam, who places him on his lap. (He's sitting on the ground by now, sitting Indian-style.)

"So, Adam," one of the boys says to him. "Are you going to keep your pet?"

"He's not a pet," Adam said, defending Robb. "He's just like us; he's human. He's just a more...compact version." He reaches for a handful of fruit from a crate nearby and puts the entire handful in his mouth. "He's probably just a little scared."

"Scared of what?" another boy asked.

"Well,wouldn't you be scared of someone who is three times your size and outweighs you by about 5 or 6 tons?" He scratched Robb's head. He hands a few pieces of fruit to Robb, who greedily consumes them. "Besides, he lives on a tiny fraction of what we eat every day; if he is a pet, he's very cheap."

"Want some protein bars?" a boy offers Robb. The tiny man grabs a few and begins eating them. "That's so cool. He's so...small." The boy brings his head in closer to watch him eat.

The party continued shortly thereafter, with everyone eventually coming over to Robb to talk to him for a few minutes. As the party passed the one hour mark, Adam glanced down to see Robb asleep on his lap.

"He's definitely not a night person," Adam said to one of his friends, standing up. "I'm going to put him away for the night. I'll be right back."

Adam goes back to his house and places Robb back on the recliner in his room. He then goes back outside to rejoin the party.

A few hours later, around one in the morning, Adam decided to call it a night. He goes back into his bedroom and lies down on the bed.

He glances over to the recliner to find...
121112.title: No

choices: A village filled with other giant boys
A village with just Peter living there
Just a house, where Peter and his family lived
124.content:
Robb looked over at the shore, where a giant, hulking figure was sitting in front of his ship. A large chunk of the vessel had been ripped off, leaving a gaping hole in the side of the ship. The gargantuan figure had one of the crates sitting next to him, as he dug through it, picking up a handful of food, eating it. He had his back to the man, giving Robb ample time to stare at the person in awe.

Robb tried to take in the overall size of the beast. He looked to be around 15 feet tall, with wide shoulders, and huge traps that snaked halfway down his back. His lats, covering the lower half of his back, rose to prominence every time he moved, the massive slabs of muscle holding immense power. The figure reached for another handful of food, and his biceps and triceps bunched up as he gripped the food, the horseshoe from his triceps clearly visible, even from 20 feet away.

The man decided to try to get away from this monster as fast as he could, before it turned around and ate him, too. Robb started walking off silently, the massive creature still with his back to him, busy rummaging through the crate. Robb pulled back a few huge leaves from a low-lying plant and entered the darkness of the jungle ahead of him.

He looked up as he walked, taking in just how big everything was. Trees stretched for hundreds of feet into the air, each one looking as big as sequoias. Flowers, which usually were no taller than his ankles, grew to nearly his waist, with huge petals blooming out. He looked up in one of the trees, to see an orangutan jumping from tree branch to tree branch, in search of food. Only this one had to be a little than Robb, instead of the usual three and a half feet.

"Just where am I?" Robb asked himself,as he made his way across the island.

The man walked around the side of a huge stone, only to discover a huge panther waiting for him on the other side. The giant cat had to be the size of a large horse, with paws roughly the same size of a polar bear's. He bared his teeth, hissing at the unwanted intruder.

The panther tried swatting Robb, succeeding in knowing him over. The man screamed, his voice echoing throughout the jungle.

The large cat stared stalking his prey, walking closer to the small man. He was just about to pounce,when a massive figure came slamming down on the ground from the sky above. The ground shook violently as he landed, causing the birds in a few dozen trees in the area to fly away in fear. It was the giant who was raiding his ship. Robb just laid on the ground, too afraid to move.

"Just get out of here!" the massive figure said to the panther, his higher voice out of place for a body that big. "He's not food for you!" The giant took one of his feet and nudged the beast away. The animal complied, walking back into the cave he lived in.

The giant figure turned around, looking down at Robb. It was a child. He couldn't be older than 11. Twelve at the most.

"Are you okay?" the massive child asked, kneeling down to get a closer look. The man backed away a little in fear. "Don't worry; I'm not going to hurt you." Robb just stared up in him, eyes wide with fear.

"What's your name, little guy?"

"R-Robb," he replied, nervous.

"Just relax," the kid said, smiling. "My name's Peter. Come on. You'll be safer if you stay with me."

Robb and the child stood up almost at the same time, and Robb noticed that he barely reached Peter's knees.

"Think you can keep up if I start walking?" the boy asked.

"Um...M-Maybe," the man replied, looking up once more at the giant kid.

Peter started walking, his giant strides causing Robb to run in order to keep up with him. The child's huge foot slammed down on the earth, shaking the ground. Robb ran, trying desperately to keep up. Just as he caught up with Peter, his other foot would leap into the air, slamming down a second later. After a few minutes of this, the man was doubled over, trying to catch his breath.

"I think it would be better if I carried you the rest of the way." Peter bent down and picked up the small man, resting him in the crook of his arm. Robb was hyperventilating, trying to catch his breath. As he was finally calming down, the boy pulled back a tree branch, revealing where he lived.
124.title: One child, 15 feet tall

choices: During dinner
After dinner
Later that night
1243.content:
Right there, in the middle of the island, was a house. A pretty large house, at that. With a big yard and everything. It was much bigger than the two room apartment Robb called home back in America. Peter put the small man back on the ground and started walking towards the home, when a woman stepped outside.

She appeared to be in her mid thirties and had a pretty trim figure. Another, more normal sized, child was playing in the front yard. It was a girl. She looked to be maybe a few years younger than Peter.

"Hey, mom, guess what?" Peter said, as he neared the front of the house. "I found a guy lying on the shore. That's him walking behind me." He pointed back towards Robb. "I also found a huge ship filled with food! You won't have to cook again for a whole year!"

"That's great, Peter," the mom replied, smiling up at her son. "Now go inside and wash up. I'll make sure our guest is taken care of."

Robb marvelled at the overall size of the house. It was the size of a mansion, it seemed. Yet, it looked like a regular house you would see in suburbia. The yard itself was probably a full acre or so in length. As he passed the little girl, who was playing on a swingset, he waved at her. She smiled and waved back.

"Hi, I'm Robb," the man said, as he approached the mother, extending his hand.

"Im Sarah," she replied. "Please, come inside." She motioned him to walk past the huge doorway and into the large living room on the other side. His mouth dropped as he tried to take in the sheer size of the place.

"Amazing, isn't it?" Sarah said, after closing the front door. "You know, Peter built this entire place by himself a few years ago. I mean, after his growth spurt was over."

"Yeah," Robb said. "Just how does a child his age grow to that size anyway?"

Sarah chuckled a little. "It's the water in this place. I don't know why, but starting from day one, Peter would grow a little bit every time he took a drink of water from the island. There's a number of springs and lakes and whatnot scattered throughout the island. Anyway, by the end of the first six months, he looked like Arnold Schwarzenegger and was nearly as tall as I was. And, over the past few years, he's kept growing until he reached his current size. I think the growing's stopped, but I swear, every time he takes a drink of water, he gets a little bit stronger. Lucky me, he's always been a good kid, otherwise I'd never be able to control him."

The two looked up as Peter passed from the bathroom to the ktchen, the house seeming to shake with every step he took.

"And it doesn't work on you or your daughter?"

"Oh,no," Sarah replied. "If that were the case, I'd be even bigger than Peter, since I drink far more water than he does."

"Have you always lived here?" Robb asked, intrigued.

"Just the past few years or so," Sarah replied. "We were thrown overboard after the cruise ship we were on at the time capsized. The three of us found a small boat and we rowed to shore. We've been here ever since."

"I have to check this island out," Robb thought to himself, as the two walked into the kitchen, revealing a very large table full of food.

"Hungry?" Sarah asked Robb, who grinned.

"I'm starving."
1243.title: Just a house, where Peter and his family lived

choices: Next morning
A week later
12432.content:
After dinner Robb tried to help clean up, but it was pointless since his platter could probably cover a whole room so they cleaned it up for him. Then Peter put him on his shoulder & took him up to his room. "This is my room. It isn't much, but it's probably worth something in society nowadays." Robb was amazed, the bed was 4x the size of a regular couch & the desk was even bigger. The window was rolled down, but next to it was the world's biggest rodent (no not a capybara). It was a gerbil that was probably so fat it could only move around via a giant exercise ball (& it barely makes it anyway). There was also a closet closed by a boulder with clothes that were big enough to fit Zachary Beaver, if he was muscular.

Then Peter got undressed until he was naked & put Robb on top of his dresser with a little bed. "I hope you like it. Don't worry, I don't move around in bed, so you'll be save from vibrations. Don't worry, I'll be here to protect you little man." Then you both went to sleep.
12432.title: After dinner

choices: During dinner
At night
124321.content:
Then the next morning Robb woke up to find that Peter was fishing for his breakfast. He caught a swordfish that was about the size of a great white shark with a nose sharp enough to poke through drywood. He carved it up & started cooking it. "So, you hungry, cuz' I figure you're going to need it to keep up here." He playfully poked your belly. "Actually, I think you'd better not waste any energy till you can get bigger. I figure it'll be better for you. I found this TV on the island & a generator run by my fat gerbil." he pointed to the cage where he found the fat gerbil running around & around & around powering the machine with incredible speed thanks to fear of punishment. from the hawks. So you stay there & watch tv. After a half hour of waiting he brings it in.

"Finally, I've been waiting all morning." He then realizes that the meal was incredibly huge. It seems that Peter was expecting him to eat half of it. "Uh, Peter. Unlike you, I'm small guy, with a small appetite. I don't think I can eat all of this."

Peter understands & looks at you with a smile, "That's okay Robb, I'll feed you till you get bigger." Then he tied you down painlessly so you would struggle. He brought out a huge funnel & was pureeing his meal of fish & fruits. You were beyond bursting point. You looked at your belly & it looks like a lumpy basketball was dropped in there. You feel like steel weights were put in your stomach. Then you go on the big scale of his. You were a measly 160lb., now you were at least 183lb. You were slowly but surely gaining weight. You realized you like it this. "You know what Peter, I like this new appetite of mine & my new belly. I hope I never lose it." You go around building a small house for yourself in his large room. By the time it was dinner. You were halfway there.
124321.title: Next morning

choices: Robb awakens in a house
Robb awakens in a large hut
Robb awakens somewhere else
125.content:
Robb was shocked by what he saw. Standing before him was the largest person he had ever seen. He had to be 20 feet tall. His frame alone was large enough to block out the sun, as Robb was now sitting completely in the shade. This person had his back to Robb, busy eating whatever he found inside one of the crates he had pulled out of the ship. Robb noticed a large hole in the side of his ship and prayed that the two hurricanes had caused that and not the giant standing less than 10 feet from him.

Robb stood up, noticing for the first time how small he really was, when compared to the colossal figure. He probably reached no higher than the top of the giant's large calf muscles, which were bigger than Robb's entire body. In fact, after looking him up and down a couple of times, Robb saw just how massive the person was.

His frame was very wide and he had the build of a professional bodybuilder, it seemed. His back muscles were clearly visible, with the huge slabs of latissimus dorsi muscles figuring most prominently. His shoulders were incredibly wide, with deltoids larger than cannonballs sitting on either side of his neck. His leg muscles were bigger than the base of a nearby tree and appeared to be harder than stone. And while he couldn't see the front of this huge person just yet, he figured he was just as big in his arms and chest.

Robb walked a little bit closer, to get a better look. The only thing covering the giant's body was a loin cloth that was wrapped around his waist, while a huge bow was lying by his feet. An equally large quiver was hanging over one shoulder, full of arrows.

Robb ventured even closer, eventually standing only a few feet away from the hulking figure. He felt so small standing next to the 20 foot tall behemoth, who was still munching away on his cargo.

Without warning, the giant took a big step backwards, as he was prepared to toss the now empty crate of food aside. The giant's foot was headed straight for Robb, who had no time to react. The heel struck him in the chest and he went flying backwards, hitting a tree 15 feet away, before slumping to the ground.

Robb watched from the ground as the giant turned around, to see what he hit. It was then that Robb noticed that the massive figure was only a boy, probably no older than 12 or so.

"It's...it's just a kid?" Robb thought to himself, not believing what he was seeing.

The kid ran towards him, each footstep causing the ground around him to shake.

Just as Robb was about to lose consciousness, he felt a pair of large hands pick him up and carry him away...
125.title: One child, 20 feet tall

choices: "I'm not an Infant," he says.
Robb is still under shock, he can't speak
1252.content:
Robb slowly began to regain his senses - he felt himself lying against a soft fabric; wool perhaps. He slowly opened his eyes, stinging as they adjusted to the dim light of a burning fire. His back was still aching from crashing against the tree. He groaned slightly as he sat up to examine his surroundings - he was equally shocked to see such a place. He looked to be in a large dome - made of tree-trunks and a straw roof. He saw that he was laying on a large mat of leather and woolen cloth - it had to be at most 30 feet long! And he wasn't truly laying on the mat, but upon the huge pillow at its head. At least it was very soft.

He looked around again - and saw an iron frame with a flat surface, above what to Robb, looked liked a Bonfire. He suddenly noticed a huge figure, squatting near the makeshift stove, its back turned to him. It was prodding the flames with what seemed to be a very large branch. The giant suddenly lifted its head.

"So, you're finally awake," it said without turning to Robb. Finally it began to stand up and turn. Robb felt his stomach sink when he saw the giant stand at a full height of 20 feet. But when he looked up at its face, he recognized it as the giant boy from the beach. "Good - you seem to be alright. Sorry about that kick, back there. But to be honest, it could've been a lot worse - I was beginning to think I'd killed you."

Robb was still in such shock that this hulk was 20 feet tall, but looked only to be 12 years old. His mouth hung agape, unable to form words. The giant raised an eyebrow at him. He slowly sat on the side of the mat, near the pillow. His head was hanging over Robb - he could see his entire body reflected in the giant's eyes.

"Are you alright, tiny one?" he asked him. "Or are you not old enough to speak yet?"

That confused Robb - did this 12 year old giant...think that he was a Child?
1252.title: A Big Welcome to the New World

choices: Get very sad
Grow more curious
1253.content:
"Hello?" a voice called. Robb groaned and shifted. He flinched as he felt something shake him.

"Mmmm... I dun wanna ge-up..." he mumbled.

"Hey! Wake up!" a child's voice pined. Another shake. Robb yawned and sat up, still incredibly drowsy. Rubbing his eyes of sleep, he cleared his throat and squinted up at the source of the voice. He jolted wide awake at the sight before him. There, seated just in front of him, was the biggest child he'd ever seen! The biggest living creature he'd ever seen! He gasped and quickly scampered back. He looked around for an escape route from this giant boy. However, this was a cave that looked a bit small, even for something as big as the giant in frount of him. The giant practically filled the mouth of the cave, cornering Robb. Now, he got a good look at the giant child. He had shaggy auburn hair, freckles lightly coating his cheeks, shoulders, and arms, big green eyes that gazed at him curiously, thick eyebrows, and even a downy layer of immature body hair on his massive chest, arms, legs, back, and belly.

"Y-you s-s-stay back!" Robb cried out, pressing his back to the very far cave wall. He was terrified beyond belief of this gigantic beast of a boy. Being so close to puberty, this massive child could do unspeakable deeds to him if he really wanted. Or even eat him! Or smash him into the cave walls. However, as he waited for death, the beastly child seemed to...
1253.title: Robb awakens somewhere else

choices: Friend!"
Big brother!"
12531.content:
The huge boy drew back at Robb's outburst. He hunched his powerful shoulders and cringed like a beaten puppy. Big tears welled up in the ginger beast's big green eyes.

"I-I'm sorry! I'm sorry!" he whimpered. He covered his face with his large, sinewy hands and began crying profusely. "I-I know I-I'm ugly!" he sobbed. Robb blinked in confusion, but refused to move. He was surprised that such a huge creature could cry and cower like a mouse. This was actually quite ironic. As minutes passed, Robb slowly relaxed. The poor kid... He really seemed sincere. Robb cautiously began approaching the beastly child. Inch by inch, he drew nearer until he stood just before his tree trunk sized calf. With a hesitant hand, he slowly laid it on the boy's slightly hairy leg. It felt soft and dense, like a teddy bear's fur. Robb was fascinated with the boy's excessive body hair. He wondered of his arm and chest hair felt like that. Reaching up, he began stroking the beastly boy's Zeus-like forearm. It was even softer and denser! This kid was going to be a gorilla when he got older! As Robb continued to pet the giant's arm, the boy removed his huge hands fom his face. Robb saw this and flinched, but remained where he was

"I'm sorry, kid. You're not ugly, you're just... Huge..." he said awkwardly. The boy sniffled and smiled slightly.

"R-really? You don't think I'm ugly?" he asked in a tiny voice. Robb smiled a bit and shook his head.

"Nah.. You just scared me because I'm small." Robb then removed his jacket and handed it to the giant to dry his eyes. Once calmed, the monstrously sized juvenile grew very friendly, very quickly.

"My name is Zack, what's yours?" he asked curiously.

"Uhh.. Mine's Robb." He was getting a bit nervous again. Zach grinned at Robb, revealing his large, animal-like teeth.

"I'm eleven years old and I've been here since I was five! That's when I became a giant." Robb nodded.

"I'm lost and I don't know how to get home again. I doubt that I'll ever get home again..." he sighed sadly. Zach picked him up and hugged him in his massively muscled arms.

"That's okay! You can stay with me! I've always wanted a..."
12531.title: Get very sad

choices: I'll let you sleep in the cave tonight and I'll sleep outside
Let me show you the island
125312.content:
Robb blanched at the sudden turn of events.

"Big brother? How could I be your big brother?" The smile quickly left Zach's face, his frown returning and his eyes beginning to water once more. Robb felt like he had been punched in the stomach. He couldn't believe that he was going to make this kid cry twice in one hour.

"You don't have to be my big brother if you don't want to," Zach said, his voice quivering as tears threatened to spill from his eyes. "I just thought that since your older than me, and because you're nice, maybe we could be brothers." The tears began rolling down his face as Robb watched. Panicking, he quickly tried to stop the tears of the gargantuan child before him.

"Hey hey hey!! I never said I didn't want to be your brother! I just... You know... How can I be your big brother since you're so much bigger than me? That's all I meant."

"Hehe. It doesn't matter if your tiny compared to me," Zach laughed shakily as he wiped his tears. "I'm just gonna keep getting bigger and bigger as I get older, even if I don't want to. And I want you to be my big brother cause I don't ever remember having a family. But if you don't want to, we can just be friends." Robb could still here a hint of sadness in the giant's, no, in ZACH'S statements trailed off. He really wanted a family, and having a big brother must be very important to him.

'I don't know how long I'll be on this island, if I can even leave,' Robb thought to himself. 'And Zach will need someone to talk to. It can't be good for him to be lone his entire life...'

" I don't think I can be your big brother Zach," Robb said hesitantly. Zach's body dropped as more tears rolled down his checks. Every huge muscle tensed and shook as he cried. He pressed his palms into his eyes , furiously trying to wipe his tears away. Zach sobbed into his hands, only peeling them away when he felt a small hand pressed against his though. Looking down he saw the face of the smiling Robb. " you're just too huge for ME to be the big brother. But I can be your older brother. That seems more.. Appropriate."

Laughing, Zach swept Robb into his arms, nearly crushing Robb into his dense pecs.

"Oh big brother, I said it wouldn't matter how tiny you are!! You still made me happy! Now we can do everything together! We can play games, I can show you where I sleep, we can talk all day-"

"We can do all those things Zach! Just let me breathe!"

"Oops!" Zach panicked, loosening his grip on his new big brother Robb, dropping him onto the damp soft rock of the cave.

"And I'm not tiny. I'm six feet five inches tall. It's you who's huge, you big goofball!" Robb laughed at how excited, yet nervous, Zach seemed to be.

"I'm sorry big brother! I won't drop you or hurt you ever again," Zach promises enthusiastically, his boyish face smiling, showing his true age despite having such a hugely muscles body. "To make it up to you...
125312.title: Big brother!"

choices: 20-foot tall 13-year-old Indian boy w' shaggy black hair & brown eyes (Nikhil)
14-foot tall 10-year-old Hawaiian boy w/ long black hair & brown eyes (Maui)
14-foot tall 10-year-old African boy w/ short black hair & brown eyes (Jamal)
10-foot-tall 12-year-old American boy w/ long blonde hair & blue eyes (Derek)
12-foot-tall 15-year-old Japanese boy w/ short black hair & brown eyes (Ken)
13.content:
Peter was starting to panic. Here he was trying to set a record as the youngest pilot ever to circumnavigate the globe solo (at 21), and now he found himself completely lost.

He had started in his hometown of St. Louis, and made it to New York, and then across the Atlantic with little trouble. Likewise, Europe had proved a piece of cake. He started heading south at that point, and had just started to cross over the Indian subcontinent when, seemingly out of nowhere, he flew right into a monster of a storm, the remnants of a typhoon. He was able to manage for a while, hoping to fly out of it sooner rather than later, but the storm just kept getting worse. And to top it off, he had flown a hundred miles off course.

Not knowing what else to do, Peter grabbed the radio. "This is Redhawk 32! Is anyone there? Over!"

Nothing but static greeted him.

"I repeat, this is Redhawk 32! I am a solo pilot needing assistance! Over!"

Still nothing.

Peter wiped the sweat from his brow, and started to talk to himself.

"Okay, all I have to do is just keep flying. This storm can't go on forever, and I'll make it out as a stronger pilot."

Suddenly, a huge bolt of lightning came flying to the sky and struck his left engine.

"CRAP!" Peter yelled, as he jumped in his seat. He looked out the window, and saw the propeller sputter, then stop.

Peter swore to himself. The plane started losing altitude fast, and started to enter into a nosedive. Peter grabbed on to his stick, and tried to remember what they taught him in flight school. He couldn't think clearly, all his training was useless. He just pulled back on the controls and prayed.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------

Peter woke up, breathing heavily. He sat up with a start, and grimaced in pain.

He was alive. Somehow, he had survived the crash. But where was he.

Slowly, he came to his feet. He looked around. He was in a clearing in the middle of a jungle of some sort, that much was obvious. A few hundred yards away, he saw the smoldering remains of his plane, crashed into a tree. The force of impact must have knocked him from the cockpit. He had several cuts and scrapes on his face, and his ankle was sprained, but, miraculously, he was still alive. And not too much worse for the wear.

As he stood there, shocked, wondering what to do next, he became aware of a loud noise in the distance. At first he thought it was the thunder, but the storm had diminished and was going away, and this noise was getting closer.

He whirled around, trying to figure out exactly what was going on. He looked to the north, and saw trees rustling. Something was coming. Something BIG.

Peter immediately started limping away, trying to find a place to hide. After a few seconds, he saw a tree with a hollow trunk, and he ran towards that, and hid inside.

He looked out through the cracks, and was stunned when, out into the clearing stepped a...
13.title: In the Jungle, the Giant Jungle...

choices: He steps out of his hiding place and introduces himself.
He remains hidden, seeing what Nikhil does
The choice is made for him -- Nikhil spots him in the tree trunk
131.content:
Peter was stunned. In front of him stood what looked like a thirteen year-old boy carrying a spear, but he was huge! He stood level with the bottom of the tree canopy. He had brown skin and dark hair that covered his ears and came down to where his shirt collar would be -- that is, if he had worn a shirt. Right now, he was only wearing a loin cloth that came down about halfway between his waist and his knees, covering only what needed to be covered.

The other thing Peter noticed immediately was how muscular the boy was! His calves looked like tree trunks, and he had the pecs and abs of a pro basketball player. He stood there, looking around, with his hand to his eyes, which were deep and brooding, and gave Peter a strange sense of calm, that maybe this boy wasn't actually so scary.

Suddenly, the boy spotted the wreckage of Peter's plane hanging in the tree, and ran over to it, looking inside. Shockingly, he picked it up, even though it was probably twice his size! "Man," Peter thought to himself, "I guess those muscles aren't just for show!" The boy sat the plane on the ground, only a few dozen feet from where Peter was hiding, and extinguished the lingering flames with a bit of water from a small leather canteen he was carrying around his waist. He then got down on his hands and knees, and searched through the plane wreckage.

Peter tried to be as quiet as possible while he assessed the situation. Should he make himself known to this boy? He didn't know what would happen, but he didn't have many other options at the moment.
131.title: Nikhil

choices: Three Humvees that were racing towards them, driven by armed mercenaries.
A group of four giant muscle boys, even larger than Nikhil
A viscous fifty-foot tall bear
1312.content:
As Peter looked around, he suddenly heard more rustling coming from the east. He stayed hidden, and watched as the giant boy turned around with a stern look on his face, like he was afraid. "What could make a twenty-foot tall muscle boy get afraid like that?" Peter thought to himself.

Suddenly, a huge black panther leaped from the trees and jumped on the boy, knocking his spear away. Peter was stunned; the panther was even bigger than the boy, at least twenty-five feet long and twelve feet tall at the shoulder. It had beautiful silky dark fur, and razor sharp teeth and claws.

The panther pinned the boy to the ground, and gave a loud growl. The boy growled right back and quickly slipped from underneath the panther's grasp. He jumped to his feet and turned to face the panther, with a wide stance as if to try and tackle him. The panther circled around, and they had a stare down for a few seconds. Then, the panther leaped at the boy, but the boy quickly dodged him, throwing the panther off balance. The boy then jumped on the panther's back. Peter could see the boy's large muscles straining as he wrestled the panther to the ground, pinning it down.

At this point Peter had enough, and he decided he didn't want to stay around to see the finish. He tried sneaking out of the tree trunk, but he accidentally stepped on a branch. The panther turned its head towards Peter and spotted him, then leapt to its feet and rushed over towards Peter. Peter saw his life flash before his eyes, cowered and covered his head as the Panther bore down on him, until the boy yelled, "Kalima! Thaharana!"

The panther immediately came to a stop, and Peter looked up to see it sitting mere feet in front of him, with a fierce but noble look on its face.

At this point, the boy ran over to the two of them, shaking the ground with his giant feet as he did so. Peter wanted to run away, but was to terrified to move.

The boy stopped next to the panther, and crouched down, examining Peter. Peter was amazed to see this huge face, with eyes as big as basketballs and a mouth that could swallow him whole, in front of him. But something about that face calmed him a little; even though it was tough, it had a smoothness and a gentleness to it that seemed comforting.

The boy reached out his hand to Peter, and said something in a language he didn't understand; he guessed it was Hindi. Shaking, Peter leaned away, instinctively trying to escape the boy's grasp. "Wh-wh-who are you?" Peter asked.

A small smile crept across the boy's face, and he stopped his hand a couple of feet in front of Peter. "My name is Nikhil," the boy said, with surprisingly little accent. "I saw your plane as it crashed into the jungle, and I came to rescue you."

Peter looked at Nikhil incredulously. "Rescue me? From what?"

Suddenly, a loud bomb filled the air. Peter spun around to see trees crashing down behind him.

"From that," Nikhil said, pointing at...
1312.title: He remains hidden, seeing what Nikhil does

choices: There village is full of many other giant muscle boys
The village is deserted
13121.content:
Three Humvees were racing towards them through the jungle. Each vehicle had three or four men hanging off of them, wearing camouflage outfits. Several of the men were carrying AK-47s, a couple had shotguns, and one was aiming a large machine gun mounted to the top of the truck. They were about 1000 feet away and closing fast.

"What the hell?!" Peter exclaimed. "Who are they?!"

Peter turned around, but Nikhil was nowhere to be seen. He looked to either side, trying to find him. 'How could I lose track of a twenty-foot tall thirteen year old?' he thought to himself.

Suddenly, he saw a black flash dart out of the woods right in front of him. It was the panther, and Nikhil was riding on top of it. They were coming towards him, and Nikhil leaned over to the side, his arm outstretched. "Grab on!" he shouted.

Instinctively, Peter reached out for the large arm coming towards him, which was almost the same size as Peter himself, and grabbed on to it as they raced by. Peter was surprised by how thick the arm he was holding onto was; he could barely get his own arms around the rippling muscles. Even though he was afraid for his life, he was slightly comforted by its strength and warmth.

With virtually no effort, Nikhil pulled Peter up onto the back of the panther. "Hold on to her fur!" he said. Peter did as he was told, lying down right in between the shoulder blades and taking a fistful of fur in each hand. The panther’s fur was smooth, with just the right amount of coarseness so that Peter could keep a tight hold on it.

After Peter got situated and a little comfortable, he looked back to see what was going on. The Humvees had caught up, and were now only a few dozen feet away. The men were now firing at them, wildly. Luckily, they were not great shots.

Nikhil was hanging on with on arm behind Peter, turning around and taking aim at the vehicles with what looked like a blow gun. WHOOSH! WHOOSH! A couple of darts flew out and struck the front tires of two of the vehicles, causing them to blowout. The men screamed and jumped to the ground as the vehicles crashed into a couple of trees.

Peter was impressed. “Nice shot!” he said.

Nikhil turned to face back forwards. “Don’t celebrate yet; I’m out of darts. Kalima! Shighra!”

The panther, who Peter guessed was named Kalima, started running faster, dashing around trees. Peter looked back, and saw that the remaining Humvee was still on their tail, and it was the one with the mounted machine gun. The merc aiming the gun let of a few rounds, and the bullets spread wildly.

A couple of bullets struck Kalima in her backside, and she let out a yelp of pain with a little leap that knocked Peter off balance. He lost his grip on the fur, and began to fall off to the ground, crying out “Whooaa!!”

As he flew through the air, he felt a hand wrap around him and pull him back. He looked up at Nikhil, who gave him a quick smile. “You got to hold on a little tighter than that!”

Peter chuckled, but another burst of gunfire from behind them caused the levity to stop. He looked back at the pursuing Humvee. “How are we gonna lose those guys?” he asked.

“Don’t worry,” Nikhil responded, “I’ve got one last surprise for them. Look,” he said as he pointed forwards.

Peter leaned up and saw what Nikhil was pointing at: they were approaching a large gorge, at least two hundred feet wide, stretching out on either side into the distance. He could hear the sound of a rushing river below.

“Are--are you gonna--” Peter struggled to form the correct words; he was hoping his eyes were deceiving him.

“Yes!” Nikhil replied. “Don’t look down!”

With one powerful motion, Kalima leapt into the air, and everything seemed to go in slow motion for Peter. Majestically, they flew in a perfect arc over the gorge. Though he had his eyes closed, Peter couldn’t help but take a peak at the raging rapids five hundred feet below them.

After what seemed like an eternity, they landed on the other side, clearing the gorge by five feet. Kalima stopped and turned around, and Peter saw the Humvee screech to a stop on the other side of the river, nearly plunging down to the waters below. The men looked at them furiously, aimlessly shooting their weapons, to no avail.

Nikhil sat straight up and put his hands next to his face, sticking out his tongue as he did so. “Ha ha!” he shouted in a taunting manner. “Janma kā pāgala!”

The mercs made obscene gestures at them, but Nikhil simply laughed, and slapped Kalima on her side, signaling it was time to go.

As they moved on, Peter said, “Who were those guys? Why were they trying to kill us?”

Nikhil simply answered, “They’re the bad guys. And they weren’t trying to kill us. They were trying to capture me.”

“What?” Peter asked.

Nikhil brought his finger up to his mouth, saying, “Shhh! It’s not safe to talk here. I’ll explain when we get home. Kalima! Ghara!”

Kalima quickly but silently moved on through the jungle. For ten minutes, neither Nikhil nor Peter said anything. Finally, Kalima stopped, and Nikhil jumped off of her back. He reached out his hand for Peter to stand on, and said, “We’re here.”

Peter crawled over to Nikhil’s hand, which was large enough for him to stand on comfortably. Slowly, Nikhil lowered Peter to the ground, and Peter stepped off. He looked around him, and saw that they were at what appeared to be a village in the middle of the jungle, with several huts forty feet tall made out of mud and logs, all at the base of very large trees stretching much taller than the trees in the rest of the jungle. But what surprised Peter most about it all was that ...
13121.title: Ambushed!

choices: "They were all kidnapped."
"They are all dead."
131212.content:
Peter was confused. The relative development in the area made it seem like there would be at least a small group of people living here, but Peter didn’t see anyone else. He scratched his head, then asked, “Where’s everyone else?”

Nikhil simply looked down at him, with a somber expression on his face. “Come inside,” he said, as he slid open the door to the closest hut, and motioned for Peter to enter.

Peter walked in. The hut had only one room, large to Peter, but a relatively small living space for Nikhil, he figured, only being about fifty feet wide and forty feet long. It was sparsely furnished, with only a twenty-foot long bed on one wall and a twelve-foot long desk and matching chair on the other. The bed was made of bamboo poles, with a mattress that looked like dozens of seat cushions sown together. The chair looked to be carved out of solid wood; it had a very rough quality to it, though it looked sturdy enough to support Nikhil’s massive frame. The desk was the most interesting to Peter, as it appeared to be made from sheet metal folded enough to approximate the shape. Peter couldn’t see what was on top of the desk, as it stood higher than his plane of vision.

Nikhil and Kalima followed behind Peter. Kalima went over to an empty side of the hut and lied down, her face looking at Peter with a fierce, but noble, look. Nikhil sat his spear and blow gun on the desk, and sat down on the bed. He sighed, running his hands through his hair.

“Would you like to sit up here on the bed, or on the desk...?” Nikhil asked, his voice trailing off.

“Um,” Peter said, “I guess the desk will be fine.”

“Is it okay if pick you up then?” Nikhil said as he crouched down.

“Yeah, sure,” Peter said, hesitantly. Though he was beginning to feel comfortable around this giant boy, he still was uneasy about the size difference.

But Nikhil was very careful, gently picking Peter up by the arms and slowly moving him over to the desk, where he sat him down. The feeling of getting picked up by another person triggered a nostalgic memory in Peter’s head of when he was a little kid, and his father would pick him up and carry him on his shoulders. It brought a smile to Peter’s face, if only for a moment.

Peter felt the metal of the desk beneath his feet as he sat down on the edge. It was smooth to the touch, if a little warped, from being forced into a desk shape, he presumed. As he sat down, Nikhil sat back down on the bed. Even with Peter’s advantage of being on the higher surface of the desk, he still had to look up to talk to Nikhil.

“So...” Nikhil said, “I suppose you want to know how this all happened.”

“Well,” Peter said, shrugging, “that would be helpful.”

“Okay,” Nikhil said. “Bear with me here. It all starts about fifteen years ago. I was a normal boy then, only about five feet tall, and was a student at a school in Delhi. It was one of the wealthiest schools in the city; all the rich people sent their kids there. I played on the cricket team, and we had just won the regional championship and were going to compete in the big national tournament in Bombay. Do you understand me so far?”

“I think so,” Peter responded, “though I’m a little confused on how this could be fifteen years ago, but I’m sure you’ll explain that. By the way, Bombay’s now called Mumbai.”

“I see,” Nikhil said, nodding. “Well, our school had chartered a flight, and, in short, we ran into a very intense storm, not unlike the one you had trouble with last night. Our plane crashed into a field a few kilometers east of here,” he said, pointing. “The pilot, our coaches and parents, all the adults on the flight were severely injured, and either had already died in the crash or would do so soon. But, amazingly, all twelve of the boys on the team survived with hardly a scratch.

“The first few days were chaotic; it seemed like each boy had a different idea of what to do. We eventually all followed Harjeet, who was the oldest among us, nearly 15, and the team leader. He split us up into two groups, one that would search for shelter, and the other that would try to rescue what we could from the wreckage. I was on the team searching for shelter, and a few miles away from the crash, we found a cave that would work for shelter. It’s only about a kilometer from here.

“So we all moved to the cave. The other group of boys tried to salvage the radio from the plane, but they could never get it to pick up or transmit a signal; there seemed to be a large interference coming from somewhere. We settled in, having enough food for about a week. But after the first four or five days, we noticed that we were all changing. All of us were developing muscle at a rapid rate, and began to grow in height. It started slow at first: a few inches here, ten pounds of muscle there, but by the end of the second week, we had grown into becoming, well, what I am now.”

“Wow,” Peter said, “so there were eleven other boys as big as you?”

“Actually,” Nikhil said, “most of the others were bigger. We all seemed to be affected differently; one boy, Kumar, who was the youngest on the team at twelve years old, ended up being the biggest among us all, at thirty feet tall with muscles like a body builder.
